New paper is out in press now!

Posted on 2019-11-04

We found that historical chemical annotations of Cinchona bark collections (including quinine, used to treat malaria) are comparable to HPLC estimations. JEP 40 years.

As part of the JEP 40 years, our new paper explores chemically annotated Cinchona bark collections (more than 150 years ago!) with currrent day HPLC technologies. We found that the alkaloid content estimations, including quinine and cinchonine, were similar with historical chemical analysis and HPLC.

How awesome is that?

Read the article here or e-mail me for a copy :).
